hero.title: FLUX Beam Air
hero.subtitle: Keep your air clean with a compact 4-layer filter made for FLUX lasers and other desktop cutters.

image.alt: FLUX Beam Air air filter next to a FLUX laser.

highlight.title: 4-layer filtration
highlight.copy: Pre-filter, cotton, HEPA H13, and activated carbon capture particles and odours from engraving.

highlight.title: Auto on/off sync
highlight.copy: Connect via USB-B to start filtering when your FLUX laser starts and stop when the job ends.

highlight.title: Quiet & compact
highlight.copy: 47 × 26 × 49 cm footprint with wheels and adjustable airflow to dial in a calmer workspace.

slalom.heading: 4-layer filter for ultra-clean air
bodyHtml: Beam Air uses a highly effective 4-layer filtration stack and a high-intake motor to block harmful molecules and odours generated during laser cutting and engraving.
It’s easy to connect and ready to use in seconds—just attach the 10 cm hose and power it on.

image.alt: Airflow through the four filters inside a FLUX Beam Air.

slalom.heading: Simple and quiet to live with
slalom.headingHtml: Simple and quiet to live with
bodyHtml: Beam Air stays compact (47 × 26 × 49 cm) with wheels that make it easy to move around your studio.
The BLDC fan, auto-standby, and adjustable airflow keep noise low while maintaining clean exhaust.

image.alt: A FLUX Beam Air filter viewed in perspective.

slalom.heading: Convenient auto power-on and turn-off
bodyHtml: Connect Beam Air to your FLUX laser with a USB-B cable and it will switch on when your job starts and power down when it ends.
Keep filtration consistent without adding steps to your workflow.

image.alt: FLUX Beam Air connected to a laser cutter with a vent hose.

slalom.heading: Adjustable ventilation makes a friendly workspace
slalom.headingHtml: Adjustable ventilation makes a friendly workspace
bodyHtml: Use the top-mounted airflow knob to set the right ventilation for your material and reduce noise for a quieter studio.

image.alt: Adjusting the airflow knob on Beam Air.

media.alt: Adjusting the Beam Air ventilation knob.

slalom.heading: Compatible with other laser cutting machines
slalom.headingHtml: Compatible with other laser cutting machines
bodyHtml: Beam Air works with any laser cutter that uses a 10 cm diameter air outlet and comes with hose adapters to make connecting easy.

image.alt: Front view of Beam Air showing airflow direction.

slalom.heading: Filtering the air
bodyHtml: When working with various materials, Beam Air filters out dust and odours to keep your workspace safe. Performance depends on the material you’re cutting or engraving.

materials.title: Dust removal
materials.subtitle: Beam Air captures dust and particles across common laser materials.

materials.title: Odour reduction
materials.subtitle: Odour filtering performance varies by material.

slalom.heading: 4 layers to keep your air clean
slalom.headingHtml: 4 layers to keep your air clean
bodyHtml: Each Beam Air filter set includes:

• Pre-filter to catch large particles.
  • Medium filter and cotton filter for finer dust.
  • H13 HEPA filter to trap airborne particles.
  • Activated carbon filter to reduce odours.
Replace individual layers as needed to keep airflow strong and your space comfortable.

image.alt: Exploded view showing the four Beam Air filters and airflow.
